block.p: DEAR DIARY:
Overheard while standing in line for tickets to ''Fantasia'' at the IMAX Theater in Palisades Center.
Man: ''Your mom says you've been acting up. I want you to listen harder to what she says. Trust me, she's a wonderful woman.''
DEAR DIARY:
Overheard while standing in line for tickets to ''Fantasia'' at the IMAX Theater in Palisades Center.
Man: ''Your mom says you've been acting up. I want you to listen harder to what she says. Trust me, she's a wonderful woman.''
Child: ''If she's so wonderful, why did you divorce her?''
AUDREY CORN

Now that spring is here and the influenza outbreaks are officially over, I recall a time when catching the flu had its good points. Back then it was known as the grippe, and along with the scratchy throat and aches and pains came a guilt-free chance to be pampered and plied with chicken soup and sleep, read and watch TV.

It's different now. I don't get the flu anymore, I get a flu shot. I take echincea and suck on zinc lozenges. I met a friend the other day while in line at the Fresh Fields in Montclair, and the conversation went like this:
Me: ''How are you?''
Friend: ''I could be worse.''
Me: That's good.''
Friend: ''No, that's bad.''
Me: ''How so?''
Friend: ''I didn't miss a day of work all winter. I'm way behind in my reading and I'm tired of taping my daytime soaps. The only bug around is in my computer. I feel unloved and uncared-for.''
Me: ''But you haven't been sick all year. Why are you so depressed?''
Friend: ''I'm flu-less.''
Me: ''Oh, get a grip.''
MARILYN COHEN VASSEN
KENTUCKY DERBY
Kentucky. The Derby. They're off at the gun --
And two minutes later some thoroughbred's won.
(If the NBA ran it, I haven't a doubt
After each quarter mile they would call a timeout.
BOB McKENTY
Stick this in the category of ''the things neighbors do.''
What's worse than the guy next to you on the commute home talking loudly on his cell phone just about the time you are dozing off?

Well, one woman asked, how about a neighbor standing in the middle of his yard at 11:30 on a weeknight talking so loudly on his cordless phone that you thought the conversation was taking place in your bedroom, where you had been sleeping?
Got you beat, a colleague offered.
''During one of the few snowstorms last winter I was awakened by the roar of my neighbor's snow blower, which he had equipped with a headlight,'' he said.
Is that touche or mush?
DIVERSIFICATION
I open the bill from my gasoline vendor
And out pops a colorful, glossy brochure
Describing a short-wave receiver, a blender,
Indispensable dryer for mother's coiffure,
Silverware, earthenware, quaint copper pots,
Luxurious luggage for going first class.
Twelve easy payments. Just sign on the dots.
Are they kidding?! I can't even pay for the gas.
BOB McKENTY
